messageBody:
I have a program I'm working on as a demonstration for my students, a
text-based mail reader that relies on the JavaMail API.

I've attempted to build an initial JUnit test (3.8 style to avoid a
discussion of annotations) which will test the condition of a valid server
connection in the mail reader. However, to get to this point in the program
the user needs to enter data such as hostname, username, and password. Then
we attempt to establish the connection and the number of emails in the inbox
is read and returned. This non-zero integer is what I'm attempting to test
for in my first test.

I have an ANT task set up to run my test, but when I do, I get the following
message:
------------- Standard Output ---------------

Welcome to the Mail Reader.

Enter the hostname of the mail server: ------------- ----------------
---------------

Testcase: testOne took 0.188 sec
Caused an ERROR
No line found
java.util.NoSuchElementException: No line found
at java.util.Scanner.nextLine(Scanner.java:1471)
at
jfmail.userInterface.JFMailTextUserInterface.getConnectionSettings(Unknown
Source)
at
jfmail.userInterface.JFMailTextUserInterface.JUNIT_TESTING_connect (Unknown
Source)
at jfmail.JFMailTesting.testOne(Unknown Source)

Questions:

* Am I correct in assuming that due to the presence of either JUnit or ANT,
the System.in stream is misdirected or overridden and thus standard input
techniques can not be used? (History: I can't get a decent ANT java task to
run the program cleanly either since there seem to be issues with the
buffering of the input prompts ( System.out.println calls).

* Is it even possible to create a JUnit test on a text-based application
which requires user input? I see no examples of this type of activity in
the JUnit documentation...

* The dashes following the hostname are not part of my output. Where did
they come from?

* Why will the program execute but not wait for user input. It does this
without fail when the program is run from the command line.


System Data:
junit version: 4.1
ant version: 1.6.5
java version: 1.5.0_08
OS: Windows XP

Thanks!!
